results.title: Proud to live
results.creator_credit: Open Channel Productions, Zelda Rosenbaum and Bob Weis
results.brief_description: Based on interviews with seven survivors of the Nazi holocaust, this documentary presents their struggle to resist degradation and their determination to survive.

results.title: Proud ships: A glimpse of the Shell tanker at work
results.creator_credit: Shell Film Unit and Philip Armitage
results.brief_description: One-fifth of the merchant ships afloat consists of tankers which form a floating chain between the oilfields of the world and the consumer. The film centres round a single tanker - the “Liparus” - on her normal run, introducing her officers and some of her crew. The modern takner is a large and handsome vessel and special care is devoted to ensuring good living conditions for officers and men. Because of possible danger there is a fixed routine of weekly boat drill, and fire-drills are taken seriously. As a result tankers are “the best bet there is on the insurance market”.

results.title: Proud remembrance
results.creator_credit: Artransa Films, Una Daniel and Frederick Daniel
results.brief_description: Melbourne’s Shrine of Remembrance - a fitting and permanent tribute to the service men and women of two world wars who paid the supreme sacrifice in battle. Story themes and narrative by Morris West. Photography by Geoff Thompson.

results.title: Proud banners

results.title: Protozoa: one-celled animals
results.brief_description: Dr Roman Vishniac, scientist and microphotographer, identifies pseudopods, flagelettes, and ciliates, showing how they move, eat and reproduce. Provides examples of symbiosis, parasitism, and colonial organisations.

results.title: Protist reproduction (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Biomedia Associates and Bruce J. Russell
results.brief_description: Shows a sexual reproductive methods of protists, including fission, with replication of organelles and subcellular particles, specialised forms of budding (in suctorians) conjugation in ciliates and algae and the production of eggs and sperm by colonial protists.

results.title: Protestant Christianity
results.brief_description: Protestantism represents the outcome of centuries of disagreement over doctrine and practice within the Catholic Church. Led by Martin Luther in 16th century western Europe, this spiritual revolution gained momentum and, under the helm of other Protestant leaders, thrived and grew into new factions around the world, especially in Europe and North America. Narrated by Ben Kingsley, this video also investigates the numerous denominations that developed over the centuries, including Calvinists, Baptists, Mennonites, Presbyterians, Puritans, Amish and Quakers.
